super-reviews-process.message: For these types of changes, the module owner should review first and make sure that all of their comments are addressed, then request a super review.

super-reviews-text.message: While the module owner will review all changes, certain changes should also be reviewed by the super reviewer, in particular:

mozilla.message: We're using a module ownership system similar to what Mozilla has.

tackle-priorities.message: Ensure all high priority issues get tackled

set-priotities.message: Set the priority of new issues and reject them if necessary

owner-role-text.message: Module owners have functional authority and responsibility over their area. Only the respective super reviewer can overrule their decisions, but this should not be necessary in practice.

review.message: Review and approve all changes to the module

api-changes.message: API changes (both public API as well as API between modules)

peer-role-text.message: One person tends to not be enough to take care of a module. Therefore module owners can designate peers that can also review and approve code, and otherwise help with their responsibilities.

super-reviewer-role-text.message: Most modules have a designated super reviewer, who will oversee things at a higher level.
